## Natural history notes

The Maryland Meadowbeauty (Rhexia mariana) is a showy wildflower native to moist meadows, bogs, and pond edges across the eastern United States. It produces bright pink to lavender, four-petaled flowers with striking yellow stamens that bloom through the summer. The plant thrives in sandy, acidic soils and adds vibrant color to wetland landscapes. Its flowers attract bees and other pollinators, making it an important part of late-season wetland communities.
